revised_title: Navigational Observations and Chart Corrections in the Red Sea
tldr: Captain Charles Newland shares a new chart of the Red Sea, along with observations and corrections made during his voyage to Mocha and Judda. He highlights an error in the chart, where the Abyssinian shore is placed too far to the westward, and mentions several small islands not included in other charts. Newland offers the corrected chart to the Astronomer Royal for potential use.
